page.title: 11Adisham: Work and Housing
page.content: Adisham has become a dormitory over the last twenty years or so. Small cottages have been modernised and new houses infill many of the open spaces. Such houses are centrally heated by gas or electricity; a few by oil and two have solar panels. Most have telephones. Many council houses are privately owned. There is a high proportion of professional people, especially scholastic, who commute to nearby towns for work, particularly to Canterbury schools and university. Some miners are employed at Snowdown Colliery. Farms employ two to four labourers now as against a dozen previously. Most villagers travel out- side the area to work while local jobs are filled by people coming in from surrounding villages. Labour relations are extremely good where staff are employed locally.
